	\newpage
	\begin{center}\section*{A+B}\end{center}
	\subsection*{Background}
This is a pretty easy problem. Just for testing.

	\subsection*{Description}
Given two integers $a$ and $b$, you need to output the $a + b$.

	\subsection*{Input}
The test contains various test cases.
Each line contains two integers $a$ and $b$.
The input ends where $a$ and $b$ are both 0.
 
	\subsection*{Output}
For each test case input $a + b$


	\subsection*{Sample}
	\subsubsection*{Input}
	{\ttfamily\begin{verbatim}
10 10
1 2
3 4
0 0
	\end{verbatim}}
\rmfamily
	\subsubsection*{Output}
	{\ttfamily\begin{verbatim}
20
3
7
	\end{verbatim}}
\rmfamily
	\subsection*{Constraints}
$|a|, |b| \leqslant 10^8$

	\subsection*{Judging Rules}
If your output is exactly the same as the standard output, you gain $100\%$ of the score. Otherwise you gain no point for this test point.


	\subsection*{Hint}
Just use the + operator.

	\newpage
	\begin{center}\section*{B+C}\end{center}
	\newpage
	\begin{center}\section*{YJQ NAIVE}\end{center}
	\newpage
